review: Plenty of features.. streaming reliability is far behind the competition.. It has been a waste of money.. Roku is far superior considering it reliably works

review: A pretty powerful set-top box - except it can't do what it's advertised to do. This device, along with Amazon's Fire project as a whole, fits with Amazon's larger business model. That is, to separate you from your money. That imperative is designed into the UI and ecosystem. The device itself has enough RAM, processing power, and I/O to make for a satisfying experience for most users. The user interface is pretty and the response is snappy. It could do everything a decent Android tablet does along with outputting Dolby 5.1 and 1080p video, but Amazon's app store is quite limited in its offerings for the Fire TV. I mean, they don't even have an app for Amazon Prime cloud photos (among many others, conspicuous in their absence). You can always sideload Android apps, but most of these are optimized for a small touchscreen, not a TV display and it can be kludgy trying to launch them.I will try to return the Fire TV and the game controller. If Amazon is OK with this, I will remove my review and not look back.
author: Silouan
